answerText: The Children of the Night[10] This poem from The Children of the Night orders its title character to "Go to the western gate... where the vines cling crimson on the wall."
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 7 | 13 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title poem of this collection states that "For those that never know the light, / The darkness is a sullen thing." For 10 points each: [10] Name this collection that also includes a poem with the lines, "They are all gone away... There is nothing more to say."
